data:
Dr. Matthew E. Edwards Research Focus Materials of Electrooptics, Pyroelectrics/Surface Resistivity of Crystal and Thin
                  Films, Development of Large Organic Thin Films, and Solitons Wave Theory Areas of Interest and Fascination Quantum Physics (Quantum Communication, Quantum Imaging, Quantum Fluctuation and Noise,
                  Quantum Sensors and Quantum Gravity), Voltage Pulse Generation from Photorefractive
                  Crystals, Photoluminescence, Sensor Science and Technology, and Remote Sensing Techniques Office: 145 V. M. Chambers Bld. Lab: 025 V. M. Chambers Bld. Phone: ‪(‪256) 372-8119 or 8104 E-Mail: matthew.edwards@aamu.edu  Recent Publications Edwards, M.E, Y.H. Hwang, and X--L Wu, "Large Deviations from the Clausius-Mossotti
                  Equation in a Model Microemulsion", Physical Review E, 49, No. 5, 1994. [This paper
                  was misreported at the American Institute of Physics from 2002-2006.] Kukhtarev, N., T. Kukhtarev, M. Edwards, B. Penn, D. Frazier, H. Abdeldayem, P. P.
                  Banerjee, T. Hudson, and W.A. Friday, “Photoinduced Optical and Electrical High-Voltage
                  Pulsations and Pattern Formation in Photorefractive Crystals, Journal of Nonlinear
                  Optical Physics & Materials”, Vol. 11, No. 4, page 445-453, 2002. M. E. Edwards, N. Kukhtarev, T. Kukhtarev, M. Bayssie, J-C Wang, M. Reagan, and S.
                  Lyuksyutov, “Voltage Pulsations in Photogalvanic Crystals as Power Supply for EO-
                  Modulator”, I, SPIE Volume 5363, no. 15, page 98-106, 2004. M.E. Edwards, N. Kukhtarev, T. Kukhtarev, M. Bayssie, J. Wang, M. Reagen, and S. Lyuksyutov,
                  “Photogalvanic Crystal as Pulsed High-Voltage Power Supply”, SPIE 5363, 2004. M. E. Edwards, S. Crutcher, and Holger Jaenisch, “Optical solitons in anisotropic
                  and inhomogeneous media”, SPIE vol. 5525, no. 9, page 163-171, 2004. N.V. Kukhatarev, T. Kukhtareva, M.E. Edwards, J. Jones, M. Bayssie, J. Wang, S.F.
                  Lyuksyutov, M.A. Reagen, and P. Buchhave, Smart Photogalvanic Running-Grating, Interometer
                  for Holographic Optical trapping on ano- and Micro-Particles”, Journal of Applied
                  Physics 97, 054301 (2005). M. Edwards, D. Patel, K. Kanzler, M. Curley, S. Bairavaras, H. Abdeldayem, C. Banks,
                  T. Gebre, M. D. Aggarwal, J. C. Wang, and M. E. Edwards, “Pockels Coefficients Characterization
                  of Pure and Iron Doped Lithium Niobate Using Adaptive Optics and the Czochralski Crystal
                  Growth Technique”, SPIE Vol. 5876, page Y1-Y11, 2005 Crutcher, A. Biswas, M.D. Aggarwal, M. E. Edwards, “Oscillatory behavior of spatial
                  solitons in two-dimensional waveguides and stationary temporal power law solitons
                  in optical fibers”, Journal of Electromagnetic Waves and Applications, Vol. 20, No.
                  6, 2006. Sundar Bairavarasu, M. E. Edwards, M. D. Sastry, F. Kochary, D. Lianos, and M. D.
                  Aggarwal "Photo-magnetism and possible optical switching in Fe3+: PMN-PT: A Photo-EPR
                  Investigation", Proc. SPIE Vol. 6314, 2006. Bairavarasu, S. R., M. E. Edwards, T. Kukhtareva, M. D. Sastry, D. Lianos, P. Kommidi,
                  B. R. Reddy, H. Jaenisch, and Mohan Aggarwal, “Photoluminescence, FTIR, and Laser-Raman,
                  Spectroscopic Studies of PMN-PT Containing Iron”, SPIE 6898, 2007. Bairavarasu, S. R., M. E. Edwards, M. D. Sastry, T. Kukhtareva, H. Jaenisch, R. H.
                  Hawrami, D. Lianos, and Mohan Aggarwal, “Photo-EPR Studies of Photorefractive BaTiO3
                  Heavily Doped with Cr3+: Evidence of Photo-Induced Dissociation of Cr3+ Dimers” SPIE
                  6698, 2007. Biswas, R. Kohl, M.E. Edwards, E. Zerrad, “Soliton Parameter Dynamics in A Non- Kerr
                  Law Media”, Progress In electromagnetics Research Vol. 1, 1-35, 2008. A. K. Batra, M. D. Aggarwal, M. E. Edwards, and A. Bhalla, “Present Status of Polymer:
                  Ceramic Composites for Pyroelectric Infrared Detectors, Ferroelectrics, Vol. 366,
                  84-121, 2008 A.K. Batra, John Corda, Padmaja Guggilla, M.D. Aggarwal, and M.E. Edwards, “Electrical
                  Properties of Silver Nanoparticles Reinforced LiTaO3:P(VDF-TrFE) Composite Films”,
                  SPIE 7419, 2009. Ryan Sassaman, Matthew Edwards, Fayequa Majid, and Anjan Biswas, “ 1-Soliton Solution
                  of the Coupled Nonlinear Klein-Gordon Equations”, Studies in Mathematical Sciences,
                  Vol. 1, No. 1, 2010, pp. 30-37 A. K. Batra, S. Bhattacharjee, A. K. Chilvery, M. D. Aggarwal, M. E. Edwards, and
                  A. Bhalla, “Simulation of Energy Harvesting From Roads Via Pyroelectricity”, Journal
                  of Photonics and Energy, Vol. 1, 1-12, 2011. Matthew Edwards, Ashok Batra, Ashwith Chilvery, Padmaja Guggilla, Manmohan Aggarwal,
                  “Characterization of Polymeric Composite Films With MWCNT and Ag Nanoparticles”, SPIE
                  Vol. 8512, 2012 M. E. Edwards, A. K. Batra, A. K. Chilvery, P. Guggilla, M. Curley M. D. Aggarwal,
                  “Pyroelectric Properties of PVDF:MWCNT Nanocomposite Film for Uncooled Infrared Detectors”,
                  Materials Sciences and Applications, Vol. 3, pages 851-855, 2012. Matthew Edwards, Padmaja Guggilla; John C. Corda; Stephen Egarievwe, “Measurement
                  of the dielectric, conductance, and pyroelectric properties of MWCNT:PVDF nanocomposite
                  thin films for application in infrared technologies”, SPIE Vol. 8868, no. 11, 2013. Quianna S. Johnson, Matthew Edwards, Michael Curley, “Analysis of the refractive index
                  and film thickness of Eu doped gadolinium oxide (Gd2O3) planar waveguides fabricated
                  by the sol-gel and dip coating methods”, SPIE Vol. 8847, no 5, 2013. Edwards, Matthew, “Recognizing the Need for Rich Contextualization in the Classroom
                  and Applying It With Modified Bloom’s Cognitive Domain Taxonomy For Successful Teaching
                  of Physics 106 (Physics II – electricity, magnetism, and Light)," Journal of Systemics,
                  Cybernetics And Informatics, Vol. 12, no. 3, pages 22-28, 2014.
